Study: Lymphopenic community acquired pneumonia as signature of severe COVID-19 infection.
Result: 85% of patients critically ill showed lymphopenia (800 cells/ml median)

Study: Distinct early IgA profile may determine severity of COVID-19 symptoms: an immunological case series
Result: Severe illness correlated with delayed, but broad SARS-CoV-2-specific IgA response

Study: Single-cell analysis of human lung epithelia reveals concomitant expression of the SARS-CoV-2 receptor ACE2 with multiple virus receptors and scavengers in alveolar type II cells
Result: ACE2-positive AT2 cells co-express pathogen receptors (e.g. DMBT1)

Study: The phenotypic changes of γδ T cells in COVID-19 patients
Result: Disproportionate increase in γδ CD4 T cells in COVID-19 patients
ORF8 Accessory protein mutations drive viral phenotypes

Study: The potential role of IL-6 in monitoring severe case of coronavirus disease 2019
Result: Elevated IL-6 associated with disease severity and progression
